item.title: 星巴克成功驳回密苏里州针对其DEI政策的诉讼
item.description: 密苏里州一名联邦法官周四驳回了该州共和党主导政府提起的诉讼。该诉讼指控星巴克利用其对多样性、公平性和包容性的承诺作为幌子，系统性地基于种族、性别和性取向实施歧视。【原文：A federal judge in Missouri on Thursday dismissed a lawsuit by the Republican-led state accusing Starbucks of using its commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion as a pretext to systematically discriminate based on race, gender and sexual orientation.】

item.title: SiTime技术有望应用于数十亿颗瑞萨芯片，SiTime首席执行官表示
item.description: SiTime首席执行官周四表示，该公司的技术最终可能应用于日本瑞萨电子数十亿枚芯片中。【原文：SiTime's technology could eventually end up in billions of chips from Japan's Renesas , SiTime's chief executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道：xAI出售交易为xAI及SpaceX投资者带来税务、财务及法律层面的多重利好
item.description: 据知情人士透露，埃隆·马斯克在SpaceX收购xAI时采用了常见的两步并购流程，该流程具有双重优势：既避免了偿还数十亿美元债务，又为股东提供了税收优惠。此举同时使SpaceX免于承担xAI的任何法律责任。【原文：Elon Musk used a common two-step merger process in SpaceX's purchase of xAI that had the dual benefit of avoiding the repayment of billions of dollars in debt while giving shareholders a tax advantage, according to people familiar with the transaction. It also protects SpaceX from any legal liability from xAI.】

item.title: 日本麒麟公司以7.75亿美元将Four Roses波本威士忌品牌出售给加洛公司
item.description: 日本麒麟控股公司周五宣布，将以最高7.75亿美元的价格将其肯塔基波本威士忌品牌"四玫瑰"出售给美国E&J加洛酒业公司。【原文：Japanese brewer Kirin Holdings said on Friday it will sell its Kentucky bourbon brand Four Roses to E&J Gallo Winery of the U.S. for up to $775 million.】

item.title: 花旗银行宣布为特朗普账户的政府捐款提供匹配计划
item.description: 花旗集团周四宣布，将为符合条件的员工家庭匹配美国政府对拟议特朗普账户的1000美元初始捐款。【原文：Citigroup will match the U.S. government's initial $1,000 contribution to the proposed Trump Accounts for eligible employees' families, the U.S. lender announced on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国邮政服务公司报告季度亏损12.5亿美元，面临现金短缺困境
item.description: 美国邮政服务公司周四报告季度净亏损12.5亿美元，该公司正面临持续的流动性问题，并再次呼吁进行改革以解决其财务困境。【原文：The U.S. Postal Service on Thursday reported a net quarterly loss of $1.25 billion as it faces ongoing liquidity concerns and renewed calls for reforms to address its financial difficulties】

item.title: 美芯科技季度利润低于预期，内存短缺影响显现
item.description: 芯片制造商微芯科技周四预测第四季度利润低于华尔街预期，引发市场对内存供应短缺将对整个半导体行业造成冲击的担忧。【原文：Chipmaker Microchip Technology forecast fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, raising concerns about the impact of a memory-supply crunch on the wider semiconductor industry.】

item.title: Atlassian上调年度营收预期，因软件支出表现强劲
item.description: Atlassian周四上调了2026财年营收增长预期，押注企业软件服务将获得强劲支出，因客户正日益将人工智能融入业务运营。【原文：Atlassian raised its fiscal 2026 revenue growth forecast on Thursday, betting on strong spending on its enterprise software services as clients increasingly incorporate artificial intelligence into their businesses.】

item.title: 美高梅度假村季度利润超预期，体育博彩业务表现稳健
item.description: 赌场运营商美高梅国际度假集团周四公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，其在线体育博彩业务的强劲表现是主要推动因素。【原文：Casino operator MGM Resorts International reported fourth-quarter profit above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, driven by strong performance in its online sports-betting business.】

item.title: 优步被判在司机性侵指控关键诉讼中赔偿850万美元
item.description: 菲尼克斯联邦陪审团周四裁定优步需支付850万美元赔偿金，此前该平台被裁定在一名女性乘客的诉讼中负有责任。该女性称自己遭司机性侵。此项判决可能影响针对该网约车公司的数千起类似诉讼。【原文：A federal jury in Phoenix ordered Uber on Thursday to pay $8.5 million after finding it liable in a lawsuit brought by a woman who said she was sexually assaulted by a driver, a verdict that could influence thousands of similar cases against the ride-hailing company.】

item.title: 交易日AI，加密货币暴跌加剧
item.description: 科技股驱动的股市抛售潮周四持续发酵，纳斯达克指数重挫至11月以来最低点，贵金属价格与比特币同步暴跌。市场对企业巨额人工智能资本支出及美国就业市场的忧虑持续加深。【原文：The tech-fueled stock market selloff snowballed on Thursday and slammed the Nasdaq to its lowest since November, while precious metals prices and bitcoin tanked, as worries over companies' massive AI capex spending and the U.S. job market deepened.】

item.title: 科蒂在首席执行官领导下将重心转向核心品牌，撤回全年业绩预期
item.description: 科蒂公司周四撤回全年业绩指引，宣布将战略重心转向核心品牌。新任临时首席执行官马库斯·施特罗贝尔呼吁加强纪律性与执行力，以扭转疲软的财务表现。【原文：CoverGirl owner Coty withdrew its full-year guidance on Thursday as it launched a strategic focus on core brands, with new interim CEO Markus Strobel calling for improved discipline and execution to turn around sluggish financial performance.】

item.title: 新闻集团季度营收超预期，得益于道琼斯业务增长
item.description: 新闻集团周四公布的第二季度营收超出华尔街预期，其道琼斯、数字地产及图书出版业务板块的增长为业绩提供了支撑。【原文：News Corp beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter revenue on Thursday, bolstered by growth in its Dow Jones, digital real estate and book publishing units.】

item.title: 赛勒斯领导的Strategy集团季度亏损扩大，比特币面临新一轮考验
item.description: Strategy周四公布第四季度亏损扩大，因数字资产市场动荡导致这家全球最大比特币持有机构的持仓出现亏损。【原文：Strategy reported a wider fourth-quarter loss on Thursday, as a turbulent period for digital assets caused the world's largest hoarder of bitcoin to record losses on its holdings.】

item.title: 独家：墨西哥寻求绕开美国关税向古巴输送燃料的途径
item.description: 消息人士称，墨西哥官员正在评估如何向古巴输送燃料以满足基本需求，同时避免触发华盛顿的报复行动。此前美国曾威胁对向该加勒比岛国供应燃料的国家实施关税制裁。【原文：Mexican officials are evaluating how to send fuel to Cuba to help meet basic needs without triggering reprisals from Washington, which has threatened tariffs against countries supplying fuel to the Caribbean island, sources say.】

item.title: Roblox预测年度预订量将强劲增长，游戏平台势头持续增强；股价大幅上涨
item.description: Roblox周四公布的2026财年预订额超出华尔街预期，预示着玩家消费和参与度将迎来又一轮强劲增长。这家电子游戏平台正积极寻求占据全球游戏市场10%的份额。【原文：Roblox forecast fiscal 2026 bookings above Wall Street expectations on Thursday, signaling another year of strong growth in player spending and engagement as the videogame platform aggressively looks to capture 10% of the global gaming market.】

item.title: Reddit营收超预期，人工智能推动广告销售增长
item.description: Reddit周四公布的季度营收超出华尔街预期，其广告平台通过人工智能技术实现的升级功能，助力这家社交媒体平台吸引更多营销商，推动其股价在盘后交易中上涨10%。【原文：Reddit forecast first-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as artificial intelligence-powered enhancements to its ad platform help the social media platform draw more marketers, sending its shares up 10% in extended trading.】

item.title: Gen Digital上调年度营收预期，因安全软件需求强劲
item.description: 杀毒软件供应商Gen Digital周四连续第三个季度上调年度营收预期，表明其数字安全服务需求强劲。【原文：Antivirus software provider Gen Digital raised its annual revenue forecast for a third consecutive quarter on Thursday, signaling strong demand for its digital security services.】

item.title: 亚马逊预计今年资本支出将达2000亿美元
item.description: 亚马逊周四与其他科技巨头一道，预测2026年将进行大规模资本支出，这是迄今为止最新迹象，表明科技公司短期内不会放缓其巨额人工智能投资步伐。【原文：Amazon.com on Thursday joined its Big Tech peers in projecting massive capital expenditures in 2026, the freshest sign yet that tech companies will not be hitting the brakes on their hefty AI investments anytime soon.】

item.title: 美国检察官表示，检察官办公室不会起诉在刑事调查中配合调查的企业。
item.description: 曼哈顿联邦检察官周四表示，联邦检察官计划加大对在刑事调查中配合调查的企业激励力度，包括承诺不予起诉。【原文：Federal prosecutors plan to increase incentives for companies that cooperate during criminal investigations, including promises not to prosecute them, the U.S. Attorney in Manhattan said on Thursday.】

item.title: 尽管政府补贴大幅增加，美国农场收入仍将在2026年出现下滑
item.description: 美国农业部周四预测，尽管政府补贴接近历史最高水平，预计将占生产者利润总额的近29%，但今年美国农场净收入仍将下降0.7%，这表明美国农民面临的压力日益加剧。【原文：In a sign of growing stress for U.S. farmers, the Agriculture Department forecast on Thursday that U.S. net farm income would fall 0.7% this year, despite near-record government payments that are expected to account for nearly 29% of producers’ bottom line.】

item.title: 英国石油公司惠廷炼油厂工人为可能的罢工做准备，工会谈判陷入僵局
item.description: 美国钢铁工人联合会周四表示，在与英国石油公司（BP）数周谈判未果后，该工会正要求印第安纳州怀廷市日产44万桶原油的炼油厂工人准备罢工或停工。【原文：United Steelworkers is asking workers at BP's 440,000-barrel-per-day refinery in Whiting, Indiana, to prepare for a strike or lockout, the union said on Thursday after weeks of negotiations with the British oil major that did not yield results.】

item.title: 可口可乐将在美国和加拿大停产冷冻产品
item.description: 可口可乐公司周四宣布，将停止在美国和加拿大市场销售冷冻产品，包括美汁源冷冻系列，以迎合不断变化的消费者口味。【原文：Coca-Cola said on Thursday it is discontinuing its frozen products, including its Minute Maid frozen line, in the U.S. and Canada markets as it tries to appease shifting consumer taste.】

item.title: 美国监管机构将审查联邦航空管理局空中交通管制培训的高失败率
item.description: 美国交通部监察长办公室周四表示，将针对空中交通管制学员的高淘汰率展开调查。当前美国长期面临管制员短缺问题，导致空中交通管理压力持续增大。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department Office of Inspector General said on Thursday it will open a probe into high failure rates among air traffic control trainees amid a long-standing shortage of controllers to manage U.S. air traffic.】

item.title: 福杰特能源在纽交所上市首日市值逼近80亿美元，人工智能基础设施需求持续增长
item.description: 福杰特能源周四在纽约证券交易所上市首日市值逼近80亿美元，尽管市场存在局部过热担忧，但投资者对服务于人工智能热潮的企业仍保持着强劲需求。【原文：Forgent Power was valued at nearly $8 billion in its New York Stock Exchange debut on Thursday, as investor appetite for companies catering to the AI boom remains healthy despite pockets of worries the market may have overheated.】

item.title: 美中两国选择不签署关于人工智能在军事领域使用的联合声明
item.description: 周四，参加军事人工智能峰会的约三分之一国家就如何规范该技术在战争中的部署达成宣言，但军事强国中美选择缺席。【原文：Around a third of countries attending a military AI summit agreed on Thursday to a a declaration on how to govern deployment of the technology in warfare, but military heavyweights China and the U.S. opted out.】

item.title: 零售商加倍投入广告支出，通过提价摆脱关税阴霾
item.description: 从增加广告支出、与温网合作到提价，雅诗兰黛和拉夫劳伦等美国零售商正竭尽全力抢占市场份额。随着市场日益呈现收入分化趋势，这些企业正试图摆脱关税压力。【原文：From increased ad spend, Wimbledon tie-ups to price hikes, U.S. retailers like Estee Lauder and Ralph Lauren are pulling out all stops to corner a slice of a market increasingly split along income lines as they try to shake off tariff pressure.】

item.title: 比特币暴跌冲击投机性囤币企业
item.description: 加密货币市场的动荡正拖累那些在资产负债表上持有比特币及其他数字资产的企业股价，引发了业界对该领域可能面临更广泛压力的担忧。【原文：Turbulence in the cryptocurrency market is dragging down shares of companies that hold bitcoin and other digital assets on their balance sheets, sparking concerns over potential broader strains in the sector.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，沙特航空正与波音和空客就其迄今为止最大规模的喷气式飞机订单进行谈判。
item.description: 据彭博社周四报道，知情人士透露，沙特阿拉伯旗舰航空公司沙特航空正与波音和空客进行初步谈判，拟采购至少150架窄体和宽体客机。【原文：Saudi Arabia's flagship carrier Saudia is in early talks with Boeing and Airbus to buy at least 150 narrowbody and widebody jets, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 默克资深人士珀尔穆特领导的Eikon Therapeutics在纳斯达克上市首日估值达8.6亿美元
item.description: 由默克公司资深人士罗杰·珀尔穆特领导的药物开发商艾康治疗公司，其股票周四在纳斯达克首次公开发行时开盘价较发行价下跌5.3%，公司估值约为8.603亿美元。【原文：Drug developer Eikon Therapeutics , headed by Merck veteran Roger Perlmutter, was valued at about $860.3 million after its shares opened 5.3% below their offer price in their Nasdaq debut on Thursday.】
